results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Country Music;Lynn, Loretta;Lynn, Oliver Vanetta Jr;Appalachian Region;Nashville (Tenn)
results.title: Loretta Lynn, Country Music Star and Symbol of Rural Resilience, Dies at 90
results.abstract: Her powerful voice, playful lyrics and topical songs were a model for generations of country singers and songwriters. So was her life story.

media.caption: Loretta Lynn performing in 1976 in Rochester, N.Y. Her voice was unmistakable, with its Kentucky drawl, its tensely coiled vibrato and its deep reserves of power.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Wines;Child Abuse and Neglect;Divorce, Separations and Annulments;Domestic Violence;Jolie, Angelina;Pitt, Brad;Chateau Miraval;France;California
results.title: Angelina Jolie Details Abuse Allegations Against Brad Pitt in Countersuit
results.abstract: In court papers related to a legal battle over a French winery they once owned together, she claims that he was abusive to her and their children during a 2016 plane ride.

media.caption: Angelina Jolie countersued her ex-husband Brad Pitt as part of a legal battle over a winery they once owned together.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Chemistry;Tests and Examinations;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Medical Schools;Jones, Maitland Jr;New York University
results.title: At N.Y.U., Students Were Failing Organic Chemistry. Who Was to Blame?
results.abstract: Maitland Jones Jr., a respected professor, defended his standards. But students started a petition, and the university dismissed him.

media.caption: Students said Maitland Jones’s course was too hard and blamed him and his teaching methods for their poor showings.
media.copyright: Janice Chung for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Missiles and Missile Defense Systems;United States International Relations;International Relations;Japan;North Korea;South Korea
results.byline: By Motoko Rich and Choe Sang-Hun
results.title: North Korea Fires Powerful Missile, Using Old Playbook in a New World
results.abstract: The last time Pyongyang launched a weapon over Japan was in 2017, when Donald J. Trump was president and Kim Jong-un seemed intent on escalating conflict with Washington.

media.caption: A screen showing images of North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, during a news update in Tokyo on Tuesday. North Korea’s missile launch prompted an alert in Japan that morning.
media.copyright: Richard A. Brooks/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.byline: By Adam Liptak and Charlie Savage
results.title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Intervene in Review of Mar-a-Lago Records
results.abstract: In earlier cases, the justices have ruled against the former president when he sought to shield his financial and presidential records from prosecutors and congressional investigators.

media.caption: Lawyers for former President Donald J. Trump appealed on narrow grounds, not asking the Supreme Court to overturn the most important part of an appeals court’s decision.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: A 95-Square-Foot Tokyo Apartment: ‘I Wouldn’t Live Anywhere Else’
results.abstract: Meet the young Japanese who have decided to live in a shoe box.

media.caption: Yugo Kinoshita, 19, in his apartment in Tokyo.

results.byline: By Isabella Kwai, Cora Engelbrecht and Dennis Overbye
results.title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded to 3 Scientists for Work Exploring Quantum Weirdness
results.abstract: Alain Aspect, John F. Clauser and Anton Zeilinger were recognized for their experiments in an area that has broad implications for secure information transfer and quantum computing.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Mixed Martial Arts;Medical Marijuana;Theodorou, Elias;Ultimate Fighting Championship
results.title: Elias Theodorou, Pioneer of Medical Marijuana in Sports, Dies at 34
results.abstract: A Canadian mixed martial artist, he brought cerebral flair to the ring and a dogged determination to his campaign for changing the sport’s drug rules.

media.caption: Elias Theodorou, right, in 2018 in a middleweight mixed martial arts bout with Eryk Anders of the United States in Toronto. He was already a widely admired sports figure when he took up the cause of medical marijuana.

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet;Social Media;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Boards of Directors;Musk, Elon;Twitter;Tesla Motors Inc
results.byline: By Kate Conger, Lauren Hirsch and Andrew Ross Sorkin
results.title: Elon Musk Suggests Buying Twitter at His Original Price
results.abstract: The billionaire’s surprise move came months after he tried to back out of a $44 billion deal to acquire the company.

media.caption: Elon Musk, center, has agreed to acquire Twitter at $54.20 per share, according to filings made public on Tuesday.

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Rap and Hip-Hop;Whites;Speeches and Statements;Paris Fashion Week;your-feed-fashion;Black Lives Matter Movement;Arnault, Bernard;West, Kanye;Yeezy (Fashion Label);YZY
results.title: There Is No Excuse for Ye’s ‘White Lives Matter’ Shirt
results.abstract: Not from Ye. And not from his new YZY collection.

media.caption: Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, at the Vogue World event last month in New York City. During a surprise show on Monday in Paris, he rebranded his fashion line Yeezy as YZY.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Nuclear Weapons;Defense and Military Forces;Radiation;Putin, Vladimir V;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad
results.title: Russia’s Small Nuclear Arms: A Risky Option for Putin and Ukraine Alike
results.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has 2,000 small nuclear weapons, but their utility on the battlefield may not be worth the longer-term costs.

media.caption: The atomic threats of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia may come as a shock to Americans who have barely thought about nuclear arms in recent decades.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Comedy and Humor;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Novak, Anthony;Onion, The;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: Area Man Is Arrested for Parody. The Onion Files a Supreme Court Brief.
results.abstract: “Americans can be put in jail for poking fun at the government?” the satirical website asked in a friend-of-the-court brief filed Monday. “This was a surprise to America’s Finest News Source.”

media.caption: The Onion ended its weekly print edition in 2009, but remains popular online. On Monday, the humor website took the unusual step of filing a brief with the Supreme Court on behalf of a man who had been jailed over a Facebook parody.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Abortion;United States Politics and Government;Walker, Herschel;Warnock, Raphael G;Daily Beast, The;Georgia
results.byline: By Shane Goldmacher, Maya King and Lisa Lerer
results.title: In Speedy Embrace of Herschel Walker, Republicans Make Familiar Political Bargain
results.abstract: While the Georgia Senate candidate denied a report that he paid for an ex-girlfriend’s abortion, his Republican allies looked past the claims toward November.

media.caption: National Republican leaders signaled on Tuesday that they planned to stand by Herschel Walker after a report that he had paid for a girlfriend’s abortion in 2009.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.byline: By Rebecca Halleck and Audra D. S. Burch
results.title: Strange Scenes of Ian: From a Doorbell Camera
results.abstract: Many people saw glimpses of the storm’s impact on their homes through their phones.

results.byline: By Jason Gutierrez and Mike Ives
results.title: Journalist Who Criticized Marcos Is Fatally Shot in the Philippines
results.abstract: The radio host Percival Mabasa was killed during an ambush, the police said. He had been a prominent critic of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and his predecessor, Rodrigo Duterte.

media.caption: Family members grieving Percival Mabasa at their home in Manila on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Jam Sta Rosa/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: Deadly Soccer Clash in Indonesia Puts Police Tactics, and Impunity, in Spotlight
results.abstract: Experts say officers are almost never held accountable for their actions. And in a huge police budget, millions are spent on tear gas, batons and other devices deployed during protests.

media.caption: Indonesian riot police clashed with protesters in Jakarta after official election results were announced in May 2019.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Judge, Aaron (1992- );Maris, Roger;Bonds, Barry;McGwire, Mark;Sosa, Sammy;Ruth, Babe;New York Yankees;Major League Baseball
results.title: With His 62nd Home Run, Aaron Judge Makes His Case
results.abstract: A blast against Texas vaulted Judge past Roger Maris for the American League’s single-season record, rekindling enthusiasm for a milestone spoiled by the steroid era.

media.caption: With a 391-foot blast against the Texas Rangers on Tuesday, Aaron Judge of the Yankees reached 62 home runs for the season, setting a new single-season American League record.
media.copyright: Nathan Hunsinger for The New York Times

results.byline: By Steve Eder, David D. Kirkpatrick and Mike McIntire
results.title: They Legitimized the Myth of a Stolen Election — and Reaped the Rewards
results.abstract: On the day the Capitol was attacked, 139 Republicans in the House voted to dispute the Electoral College count. This is how they got there.

media.caption: An aide inspected the official tally to certify the vote hours after rioters had stormed Congress to disrupt the transfer of power.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Records and Achievements;Judge, Aaron (1992- );Major League Baseball;New York Yankees
results.title: Can Aaron Judge Hit Home Run No. 62? Here’s How to Assess His Chances.
results.abstract: We estimate that Judge has about 14 hittable pitches left to hit a homer in the regular season. He was unsuccessful in the Yankees’ afternoon game against the Texas Rangers, but they play again at night.

media.caption: Aaron Judge still has a decent chance of hitting his 62nd home run of the season, but he has to do it by Wednesday.
media.copyright: Nathan Hunsinger for The New York Times
